      • getCursorBundleOnSearchQueryChange

        public abstract android.os.Bundle getCursorBundleOnSearchQueryChange(java.lang.String queryText)
        Method which will pass the corresponding paramters to create a new Cursor adapter for the results. The bundle should contain the common elements of a cursor:
        • A String with key "uri" containing the unparsed Uri to use for looking up the content. This is mandatory.
        • A String array with key "projection" to use as cursor projection. Not mandatory.
        • A String with key "selection" to use as cursor selection. Not mandatory.
        • A String array with key "selectionArgs" to use as selection arguments for the cursor. Not mandatory.
        • A String with key "sortOrder" to use as sorting order for the cursor. Not mandatory.
          Returns:
          The bundle with at least the unparsed Uri set.

        • getEmptyCursorAdapter

          public abstract CursorAdapter getEmptyCursorAdapter()
          Method which will initialize the cursor adapter with the layout of the list rows and the array of String of the cursor column names and the array of int of the layout id's to use
          Returns:
          an empty cursor adapter (initialized with null Cursor)

        • onItemClick

          public abstract void onItemClick(CursorAdapter adapter,
                                 android.view.View view,
                                 int position,
                                 long id)
          Method that will be triggered when the user selects a listview item.
          Specified by:
          onItemClick in interface android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemClickListener
          Parameters:
          adapter - the adapter of the listview
          view - the clicked view
          position - the position of the clicked view
          id - the id of the view

        • onSearchClick

          public abstract void onSearchClick(java.lang.String query)

          Parameters:
          query - The query entered by the user
